meanings.definition: In a manner that shows extreme enthusiasm or excitement.
meanings.sent1: She cheered madly when her team won the game.
meanings.sent2: The children ran madly around the playground, laughing and playing.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wagged its tail madly as it chased its own shadow.
meanings.sent4: The flowers bloomed madly in the warm spring sun.
meanings.sent5: The crowd clapped madly as the performer took a bow.

meanings.definition: In a manner that shows extreme anger or frustration.
meanings.sent1: He shouted madly at the rude driver who cut him off.
meanings.sent2: The customer complained madly about the poor service at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The computer beeped madly after the power surge.
meanings.sent4: The storm raged madly outside, shaking the windows.
meanings.sent5: The toddler threw his toys madly when he couldn't get his way.
